page.title: 09Conservation
page.content: British farmers have in general, been much criticised for{removing {hedges}in order to enlarge their fields and give easier access to their larger farm machinery. This has decimated the{natural habitats}of wildlife and vegetation, and has inevitably upset the balance of nature. Farming organisations are now very concerned about this, and the image of farming communities. So,they are spending enormous sums of money to {re-site and replace}any natural growth they remove in the name of progress. The owner of Weston Mill has been particularly active in this, and has planted trees in great numbers along the roadsides on his property. He is very anxious that the Public recognise that fact, and are not unfairly critical of modern farming methods.
